required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Clinical Results of Two Cementless Femoral Stem
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Clinical Results of Two Cementless Femoral Stem

brief_summary.textblock: In the present study, two types of cementless femoral stem- UTS Stem and UTF-reduced Stem- were utilized in total hip arthroplasty. Due to the design for proximal femur fixation, both femoral stems could prevent stress shielding around the implant, further preventing osteolysis. The difference between both femoral stems is the length, in which UTS Stem is 20% shorter than UTF-reduced Stem. The clinical outcomes of both femoral stems will be compared. Both femoral stems are expected to have equally good radiologic outcome and clinical performance.

primary_outcome.description: Numerical Rating Scale is a patient-reported outcome measure. The scale ranges from 0 to 10. A score of 0 represents no pain, while a score of 10 represents extreme pain.
Harris Hip Score includes 4 sections that evaluate pain, function, deformity, and range of motion. Total scores is from 0 to 100, higher scores represent a better outcome.

SF-36 is a set of generic, coherent, and easily administered quality-of-life measures. These measures rely upon patient self-reporting and are now widely utilized by managed care organizations and by Medicare for routine monitoring and assessment of care outcomes in adult patients. It consists of two sections, physical component summary and mental component summary, with 36 items in total.
DEXA scanning is used to monitor and quantify bone mineral density, which helps to understand if the implant has an effect on the change of bone mineral density.
Radiologic analysis helps observe the existence of radiolucent lines, which can be analyzed to determine if implant loosening occurs.
Morphology of the proximal femur was classified using Dorr Type.
Radiologic analysis helps measure the degree of the alignment of the hip.

arm_group.description: The subjects who received UTS Stem in total hip arthroplasty.
The subjects who received UTF-reduced Stem in total hip arthroplasty.

intervention.description: The indication for total hip arthroplasty is mainly osteoarthritis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who receive total hip arthroplasty with either a UTS femoral stem or a UTF-reduced femoral stem after June, 2020 at Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who receive total hip arthroplasty with either a UTS femoral stem or a UTF-reduced femoral stem after June, 2020
2. Patients who have not received total hip arthroplasty in the past
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who are unable or unwilling to return for follow-up
2. Patients who suffer from mental disorders

facility.name: Joint Reconstruction Division at Chang Gung Memorial Hospital, Linkou
